definition: lit. body and shadow follow each other (idiom)/fig. inseparable
to appear/to look/form/shape
picture/image/film/movie/photograph/reflection/shadow/trace
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
surname Sui
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently

sentences.english: Achievement and calmness follow each other says Mr Martin.
sentences.chinese: 成就和冷静是形影相随的，马丁如是说。

sentences.english: High unemployment and high crime often go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 高失业率和高犯罪率经常形影相随。

sentences.english: From that hot day in 1953, he became my shadow.
sentences.chinese: 就从1953年那个热天开始，它就与我形影相随了。

sentences.english: Disappointment’s cousin is frustration, the second storm.
sentences.chinese: 沮丧是失望的表亲，他们总是形影相随。

sentences.english: Euphemistic expressions are originally used to replace taboos related to religions and superstitions.
sentences.chinese: 委婉语最初是与和宗教迷信有关的禁忌语形影相随的。

sentences.english: The first wife is man's heart and we shadow, life and death everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 第一个妻子则是人的心，和我们形影相随，生死不离。

sentences.english: Purpose does not linger, but moves steadily along with you, whatever you do and wherever you go.
sentences.chinese: 她不会徘徊不定，无论何时何地，都与你形影相随。

sentences.english: Customer satisfaction is the enterprise survival, products and services in northwestern hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 客户的满意是企业生存之本，产品服务形影相随。

sentences.english: Educational criticism connects with education all along.
sentences.chinese: 教育批评从来都和教育形影相随。

sentences.english: Not to show anyone, but just to have it with him like a friend.
sentences.chinese: 他不让任何人看到它，如对待朋友一样形影相随。

definition: inseparable (as form and shadow)
to accompany sb/to accompany each other
to be interdependent
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
from dawn to dusk/all the time
lit. heads rubbing together (idiom)/fig. very close relationship
to stay together/to rely on one another
to stand by (sb) (idiom)/steadfast loyalty
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
two hearts beat as one (idiom); a kindred spirit
inseparable
lit. a pair of birds flying close together (idiom)/fig. two hearts beating as one/name of a sweet and sour chicken wing dish
lit. in the same boat under wind and rain (idiom); fig. to stick together in hard times
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
